blog.title: Week 4
blog.author: Kristen Norris
celebrations: Created a factory function to make updating my blog page easier
Learned how to have a split screen view on my laptop
Successfully created a blog form that allows me to add blog posts through the blog admin page, save them to local storage and update the blog page
challenges: Understanding the Lexscopistan Heap Skope exercise

blog.title: Week 3
blog.author: Kristen Norris
celebrations: Watched NSS grad, Aimee Knight’s talk about “Getting Comfortable with being Uncomfortable”
Learning how to effectively work in a group to complete a challenge (pagination) that was given the day before the project was due
Getting better at commenting my code so I know what I did when I look back at it later on
challenges: Breaking my code by forgetting a parenthesis in the Colored-Reindeer exercise

blog.title: Week 2
blog.author: Kristen Norris
celebrations: Finally figured out how to get the Cash-to-Coin exercise to work
Created a dynamic navigation bar for group project
Successfully created a group website using GitHub
challenges: Figuring out how to include embedded Google Maps into the Contact Page of our group project
Managed to accidently pull someone else’s branch into my feature branch
Dealing with pushing and pulling branches in GitHub

blog.title: Week 1
blog.author: Kristen Norris
celebrations: Got to see Cohort 21 present their Front-End Capstone projects
Successfully set-up the framework for my personal site and connected it to GitHub
Was able to figure out the Overly Excited JavaScript exercise without feeling completely overwhelmed
challenges: Remembering all of the commands for the terminal
Figuring out the best way to organize code
Not sure where to start with the Cash-to-Coin JavaScript exercise

blog.title: Week 5
blog.author: Kristen Norris
celebrations: Created a separate pagination JavaScript file so that pagination can easily be added to other pages
Added a Search bar to my blog page
Was able to get out of the infinite loop I (accidentally) created and complete part of the Lexscopistan Heap Skope exercise
Added password protection to my "create blog post" form
challenges: Completing the second part of the Lexscopistan Heap Skope exercise where the gem values don’t need to be hard coded
Figuring out how to create the Search bar on my blog page so that it was filtering through the unordered lists
Adding Grunt and ESLint to my personal site
